summary: The Brownfield Revitalization and Remediation Act aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.  It focuses on restoring and expanding the expensing of qualified environmental remediation expenditures. The bill seeks to allow for the deduction of costs related to assessing contaminated sites, clarifies the definition of hazardous substances, and adjusts rules for depreciable property on brownfield sites. The Act's effective date is the date of enactment.
